text: What you said is what i understood from the response body too, that some property was missing from my body, but i couldnt find any JSON body example for this particular case. Btw. thanks for your fast answer, i missed it completely yesterday:upside_down_face:
Could you please share example API. I didnt get proper idea in the document.
Why do we get? - `"status":"BAD_HUB","message":"missing or unknown hub id"`

Hey guys, HubSpot listed apps have a different rate limit?
I'm asking this because I have a client using an integration that I built, and they will use the search API a lot of times(~400k times/day), and I think that a maximum of 4 requests per second isn't enough

Hi All
Is there an API which would return all configured variation langauge for Blogs and Landing pages?

Hi Everybody, is there a way so send events via the API to track Call To Action conversions? E.g. we send some users to our login page via CTA and I would like to send an event back if there was an account created coming from that CTA. How would I go about doing something like that?
which api are you using?
The 4/second wouldn't change, the daily calls could change but not the secondly limit
<@U01QVR44MEY> is there a place which describe rate limits for listed apps?
For sure: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details>
Remember the search api works 4/second per token
So just like a private app has a token a public app also has a token
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/associations>
So you'll want to use this endpoint:
You can see the translations if you retrieve a blog post:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/blog-post>
I need to know what all languages are configured in HubSpot as avaibale variations
At system level
Yeah the translations will return that
oh you don't want it for one blog
Yes
You just want all your options
I need what is configured at system level
understood
So I don't think you can do this through the api level but you can do it through the UI <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/blog/create-a-multi-language-blog>
Yeah i am aware of that but wanted to see if its available at api level
So CTA should already be tracked by HubSpot,
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/ctas/calls-to-action-frequently-asked-questions>
But another way you can do it is through behavioral events <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/analytics/events>
Yeah unfortunately I don't think it is
thanks! that looks like a good idea
of course, let me know how it goes
Thanks a lot! i will try this way.
of course

I just tried with the body example you gave me and still getting an error response:

{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Invalid input JSON on line 1, column 1: Cannot deserialize value of type `java.util.ArrayList<com.HubSpot.inbounddb.base.requests.CreateObjectRequest<com.HubSpot.companies.data.CompaniesProtos$Company>>` from Object value (token `JsonToken.START_OBJECT`)",
    "correlationId": "248fdafe-726c-46dc-bd94-89fce39167bd"
}

Can you tell me wich endpoint url should i be using? I have been using "<https://api.hubapi.com/companies/v3/companies/batch>", maybe my url is also wrong, idk.

If I already have an api secondary domain established in my HubSpot account and my developer wants to attach another IP address to it for website page calls, is that possible or do I need to create a new domain?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1678289462627049?thread_ts=1678289241.455419&cid=C2YHAHB6K>
<@UD53A9UUR> Do you have any ideas here?
Yeah so you want to be using this url: */crm/v3/objects/companies/batch/create*
replace `pat-na1-xxxxxx` with your token

Of course it works now! Thanks a lot for your help again. ill be also taking a closer look to your suggestion, i dont fully understand the difference right away but im also kind of new to all this. Thanks again, and have a good evening!
i am unsure what is being asked here…
<@U014JRZ096U> could you explain exactly what you and your dev want to do?  maybe an example?
Hello! I need assistance getting an Client ID and Client Secret for my private app, since i am trying to integrate AWS AppFlow with HubSpot. Help would be greatly appreciated :smile:
Of course, you too
Private apps don't have Client IDs and Client Secrets
Only public apps have those
my dev wants to add an IP address to an existing domain we host through HubSpot
So to create an AppFlow integration I have to make a public app?
Yep I believe that's the case, unless they have an option to insert a private app token
I personally don't use AppFlow so can't say this with 100% certainty
Thank you <@U01QVR44MEY> it looks to have what I need, ill test it and let you know for future reference :slightly_smiling_face:
Sounds good, you're welcome
